description.intro: 哈囉！我是 Nelson，aka nelsonGX，是一位來自台灣的學生，對資訊相關領域充滿熱情。
description.work: 我目前經營超級快網路有限公司 (ASN: 152619)，營運 CheapServer 託管服務。除了這個主要業務外，我還經營 FreeServer，一個免費託管服務社群。我也管理一個名為 FreeServer Network 的 Minecraft 伺服器，主要專注於地圖創作者的分享平台。
description.community: 我會參與社群活動，會在像是 SITCON、HITCON 和 COSCUP 之類的活動裡出現，藉此學習並與其他好朋友交流。

javascript.confidence: Not bad, but I hate it

serverManagement.heading: 伺服器 & 網路維運
serverManagement.description: 我是好幾個託管的創辦人，在維運伺服器與託管網站方面有一些經驗。

codingDevelopment.title: aboutme.exe - coding_and_development
codingDevelopment.heading: 程式設計 & 開發
codingDevelopment.description: 如你所見，我會寫 code，我曾寫過 Python、Java、JS...等等語言，大部分情況下，我仍在邊做邊學。你可以在下面找到我的 Github：

minecraft.title: aboutme.exe - minecraft
minecraft.heading: Minecraft
minecraft.description: 我已經遊玩 Minecraft 7 年了，我在這個遊戲中學會了很多東西。我會寫插件之類的東西。
minecraft.content: Minecraft has been a big part of my journey. I've been building servers, creating plugins, and designing experiences for players. My experience spans from simple automation scripts to complex multiplayer servers with custom game mechanics.

footer.subtitle: 來自台灣的學生 & 開發者

techStack.title: Tech stack
techStack.javascript: Not bad, but I hate it

start.title: How it all started...
start.description: Started with Python like everyone else. The first real project was started from a Discord bot. I was interested and learnt how to use Discord APIs. About few years later, LLMs came out and I started making Discord chatbots. It was pretty fun.

webDev.title: Web Development
webDev.description: About the website, I always wanted to make websites but I hated pure HTML and CSS. One time our team needed to make a web app for a project, and one of my friend bring me into Next.JS. I was like, omg its so better, and started to learn and use it. Now I have several projects using Next.JS.

java.title: Java & Bukkit API
java.description: After opening FreeServer (please view the Server Managing & Networking part if you havn't), I waned to make a Minecraft server called FreeServer Network. I need custom plugins for the server, but I don't want to pay others to do it. So I started to learn Java and Bukkit API. I made several plugins for the server, and it was a great experience. I am still learning.

freeserver.part1: FreeServer was a project started by me and Mayboy. Initially, I noticed my friend Mayboy using Google Cloud Platform (GCP)'s free 300 USD plan, and I wondered if we could use it for free hosting. So, we invited our friend Windless to join the project.
freeserver.part2: FreeServer provided free hosting for Minecraft servers and Discord bots. The free specs included 1 vCPU, 4 GB RAM, and 10 GB of disk space. The server was located in Taiwan. These specs were quite generous for free hosting in Asia.
freeserver.part3: The server faced a lot of DDoS traffic initially, until we met Alger Huang, the owner of Fast-Line, who offered free anti-DDoS service for us. After about 4 months, we encountered policy changes from GCP and the end of Fast-Line's free anti-DDoS service. Eventually, we decided to shut down FreeServer in August 2022.

cheapserver.part1: With the earnings from FreeServer, we decided to launch a paid server hosting service called CheapServer. This time, we brought in our friend CH to join the business.
cheapserver.part2: When CheapServer started, there were no hosting services in Taiwan that could match our low prices (as we believed). We gained customers from the beginning.
cheapserver.part3: CheapServer is still operational today. We have a growing customer base and continuously strive to improve our service.

freeserverv2.part1: After CheapServer, we missed the good old days of operating FreeServer. So, this time, we invested some money from CheapServer instead of relying on free trials from GCP to run FreeServer v2.
freeserverv2.part2: First, we purchased a VPS from Taipei 101 (one of my friends) and started the hosting. We reused the website components from FreeServer v1. However, we encountered some collaboration issues, so we switched to Hetzner as the server provider.
freeserverv2.part3: Unfortunately, we ran out of funds and became exhausted. As a result, we made the decision to shut down FreeServer v2 in July 2023.

freeserverv3.part1: During a Discord voice chat, my friend Ricky (aka Smitug) suggested reopening FreeServer. I had been considering it as well. So, we decided to relaunch it, this time using our own server infrastructure. Our goal is to make it even better than before.
freeserverv3.part2: FreeServer v3 is still in operation today. We have acquired over 7,000 users and 1,700+ active servers, and the numbers continue to grow.
